definition.name: ResizablePanelGroup
definition.description: A container component that groups multiple ResizablePanel components together and manages their layout and resizing behavior. It supports both horizontal and vertical layouts.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the panel group

direction.description: The direction in which panels are arranged

definition.visualLayout: A flex container that arranges ResizablePanel components either horizontally or vertically, with ResizableHandle components between them for resizing.
interactions: Manages the layout and sizing of child ResizablePanel components
Handles the coordination between panels during resize operations
Adapts layout based on direction prop

definition.name: ResizablePanel
definition.description: A panel component that can be resized using ResizableHandle components. It's a direct wrapper around ResizablePrimitive.Panel that maintains its core functionality.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the panel

defaultSize.description: The default size of the panel as a percentage

minSize.description: The minimum size of the panel as a percentage

definition.visualLayout: A flexible container that can be resized relative to its siblings within a ResizablePanelGroup

definition.name: ResizableHandle
definition.description: A resizable handle component that allows users to resize panels by dragging. It can optionally display a grip handle for better visual feedback and usability.

withHandle.description: When true, displays a visual grip handle in the center of the resize handle

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the resize handle

definition.visualLayout: A vertical or horizontal line that serves as a resize handle between panels. When withHandle is true, it displays a small grip icon in the center of the handle.
interactions: Can be dragged to resize adjacent panels
Shows focus states when interacted with keyboard
Adapts its appearance based on the panel group direction (vertical/horizontal)
